fields.label: Name for Schema (name > Text)
fields.name: brandorg_name
fields.instructions: Name of the organization

fields.label: Legal Name (legalName > Text)
fields.name: brandorg_legalname
fields.instructions: The official name of the organization, e.g. the registered company name.

choices.0: None — No available option is relevant to this organization
None — No available option is relevant to this organization

fields.label: Description for Schema (description > Text)
fields.name: brandorg_description
fields.instructions: A description of the organization

fields.label: Disambiguating Description (disambiguatingDescription > Text)
fields.name: brandorg_disambiguatingdescription
fields.instructions: A sub property of description. A short description of the organization used to disambiguate from other, similar organization. Information from other properties (in particular, name) may be necessary for the description to be useful for disambiguation.

fields.label: Slogan (slogan > Text)
fields.name: brandorg_slogan
fields.instructions: A slogan or motto associated with the organization.

fields.label: Logo (logo > URL)
fields.name: brandorg_logo
fields.instructions: Logo for the organization

fields.label: Image (image > URL)
fields.name: brandorg_image
fields.instructions: An image of the organization

fields.label: Address (contactPoint > PostalAddress)
fields.name: brandorg_contactpoint_postaladdress
fields.instructions: Make the first repeater row the primary address.

sub_fields.label: Address Type (contactType > Text)
sub_fields.name: brandorg_contactpoint_postaladdress_contacttype
sub_fields.instructions: A person or organization can have different contact points, for different purposes. For example, a sales contact point, a PR contact point and so on. This property is used to specify the kind of contact point.

sub_fields.label: Street Address or Post Office Box?
sub_fields.name: brandorg_contactpoint_postaladdress_streetaddress_query

sub_fields.label: Street Address (streetAddress > Text)
sub_fields.name: brandorg_contactpoint_postaladdress_streetaddress
sub_fields.instructions: The street address. For example, 1600 Amphitheatre Pkwy.

sub_fields.label: Post Office Box Number (postOfficeBoxNumber > Text)
sub_fields.name: brandorg_contactpoint_postaladdress_postofficeboxnumber
sub_fields.instructions: The post office box number for PO box addresses.

sub_fields.label: City or Other Locality (addressLocality > Text)
sub_fields.name: brandorg_contactpoint_postaladdress_addresslocality
sub_fields.instructions: The locality in which the street address is, and which is in the region. For example, Mountain View.

sub_fields.label: State or Other Region (addressRegion > Text)
sub_fields.name: brandorg_contactpoint_postaladdress_addressregion
sub_fields.instructions: The region in which the locality is, and which is in the country. For example, California or another appropriate first-level Administrative division.

sub_fields.label: Postal Code (postalCode > Text)
sub_fields.name: brandorg_contactpoint_postaladdress_postalcode
sub_fields.instructions: The postal code. For example, 94043.

sub_fields.label: Country (addressCountry > Country or Text)
sub_fields.name: brandorg_contactpoint_postaladdress_addresscountry
sub_fields.instructions: The country. For example, USA. You can also provide the two-letter ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code.

fields.label: Phone Number (contactPoint > ContactPoint)
fields.name: brandorg_contactpoint_telephone
fields.instructions: Make the first repeater row the primary phone number.

sub_fields.label: Individual Telephone Number Type (contactType > Text)
sub_fields.name: brandorg_contactpoint_telephone_contacttype
sub_fields.instructions: A person or organization can have different contact points, for different purposes. For example, a sales contact point, a PR contact point and so on. This property is used to specify the kind of contact point.

sub_fields.label: Individual Telephone Number (telephone > Text)
sub_fields.name: brandorg_contactpoint_telephone_text
sub_fields.instructions: The telephone number.

choices.HearingImpairedSupported: Hearing Aid Supported — Uses devices to support users with hearing impairments.
choices.TollFree: Toll-Free — The associated telephone number is toll free.

fields.label: Fax Number (contactPoint > ContactPoint)
fields.name: brandorg_contactpoint_faxnumber
fields.instructions: Make the first repeater row the primary fax number.

sub_fields.label: Individual Fax Number Type (contactType > Text)
sub_fields.name: brandorg_contactpoint_faxnumber_contacttype
sub_fields.instructions: A person or organization can have different contact points, for different purposes. For example, a sales contact point, a PR contact point and so on. This property is used to specify the kind of contact point.

sub_fields.label: Individual Fax Number (faxNumber > Text)
sub_fields.name: brandorg_contactpoint_faxnumber_text
sub_fields.instructions: The fax number.

fields.label: Email Address (contactPoint > ContactPoint)
fields.name: brandorg_contactpoint_email
fields.instructions: Make the first repeater row the primary email address.

sub_fields.label: Individual Email Address Type (contactType > Text)
sub_fields.name: brandorg_contactpoint_email_contacttype
sub_fields.instructions: A person or organization can have different contact points, for different purposes. For example, a sales contact point, a PR contact point and so on. This property is used to specify the kind of contact point.

sub_fields.label: Individual Email Address (email > Text)
sub_fields.name: brandorg_contactpoint_email_text
sub_fields.instructions: Email address.

fields.label: URL (url > URL)
fields.name: brandorg_url
fields.instructions: URL of the organization

fields.label: Main Entity of Page (mainEntityOfPage > URL)
fields.name: brandorg_mainentityofpage
fields.instructions: Indicates a page (or other CreativeWork) for which this thing is the main entity being described.

fields.label: Is Accepting New Patients (isAcceptingNewPatients > Boolean)
fields.name: brandorg_isacceptingnewpatients
fields.instructions: Whether the organization is accepting new patients.

fields.label: Actionable Feedback Policy (actionableFeedbackPolicy > URL)
fields.name: brandorg_actionablefeedbackpolicy
fields.instructions: For a NewsMediaOrganization or other news-related Organization, a statement about public engagement activities (for news media, the newsroom’s), including involving the public - digitally or otherwise -- in coverage decisions, reporting and activities after publication.

fields.label: Corrections Policy (correctionsPolicy > URL)
fields.name: brandorg_correctionspolicy
fields.instructions: For an Organization (e.g. NewsMediaOrganization), a statement describing (in news media, the newsroom’s) disclosure and correction policy for errors.

fields.label: Diversity Policy (diversityPolicy > URL)
fields.name: brandorg_diversitypolicy
fields.instructions: Statement on diversity policy by an Organization e.g. a NewsMediaOrganization. For a NewsMediaOrganization, a statement describing the newsroom’s diversity policy on both staffing and sources, typically providing staffing data.

fields.label: Diversity Staffing Report (diversityStaffingReport > URL)
fields.name: brandorg_diversitystaffingreport
fields.instructions: Statement on diversity policy by an Organization e.g. a NewsMediaOrganization. For a NewsMediaOrganization, a statement describing the newsroom’s diversity policy on both staffing and sources, typically providing staffing data.

fields.label: Ethics Policy (ethicsPolicy > URL)
fields.name: brandorg_ethicspolicy
fields.instructions: Statement about ethics policy, e.g. of a NewsMediaOrganization regarding journalistic and publishing practices, or of a Restaurant, a page describing food source policies. In the case of a NewsMediaOrganization, an ethicsPolicy is typically a statement describing the personal, organizational, and corporate standards of behavior expected by the organization.

fields.label: Ownership Funding Information (ownershipFundingInfo > URL)
fields.name: brandorg_ownershipfundinginfo
fields.instructions: For an Organization (often but not necessarily a NewsMediaOrganization), a description of organizational ownership structure; funding and grants. In a news/media setting, this is with particular reference to editorial independence. Note that the funder is also available and can be used to make basic funder information machine-readable.

fields.label: Publishing Principles (publishingPrinciples > URL)
fields.name: brandorg_publishingprinciples
fields.instructions:
The publishingPrinciples property indicates (typically via URL) a document describing the editorial principles of an Organization (or individual, e.g. a Person writing a blog) that relate to their activities as a publisher, e.g. ethics or diversity policies. When applied to a CreativeWork (e.g. NewsArticle) the principles are those of the party primarily responsible for the creation of the CreativeWork.

While such policies are most typically expressed in natural language, sometimes related information (e.g. indicating a funder) can be expressed using schema.org terminology.

fields.label: Unnamed Sources Policy (unnamedSourcesPolicy > URL)
fields.name: brandorg_unnamedsourcespolicy
fields.instructions: For an Organization (typically a NewsMediaOrganization), a statement about policy on use of unnamed sources and the decision process required.

fields.label: Health Plan Network ID (healthPlanNetworkId > Text)
fields.name: brandorg_healthplannetworkid
fields.instructions: Name or unique ID of network. (Networks are often reused across different insurance plans.)

fields.label: Ticker Symbol (tickerSymbol > Text)
fields.name: brandorg_tickersymbol
fields.instructions: The exchange traded instrument associated with a Corporation object. The tickerSymbol is expressed as an exchange and an instrument name separated by a space character. For the exchange component of the tickerSymbol attribute, we recommend using the controlled vocabulary of Market Identifier Codes (MIC) specified in ISO 15022.

fields.label: Dun & Bradstreet Data Universal Numbering System (DUNS) Number (duns > Text)
fields.name: brandorg_duns
fields.instructions: The Dun & Bradstreet DUNS number for identifying an organization or business person.

fields.label: International Standard of Industrial Classification of All Economic Activities, Revision 4 Code (isicV4 > Text)
fields.name: brandorg_isicv4
fields.instructions: ISIC Rev. 4 code for a particular organization, business person, or place.

fields.label: International Organization for Standardization 6523 Code (iso6523Code > Text)
fields.name: brandorg_iso6523code
fields.instructions: An organization identifier as defined in ISO 6523(-1). Note that many existing organization identifiers such as leiCode, duns and vatID can be expressed as an ISO 6523 identifier by setting the ICD part of the ISO 6523 identifier accordingly.

fields.label: Legal Entity Identifier (leiCode > Text)
fields.name: brandorg_leicode
fields.instructions: An organization identifier that uniquely identifies a legal entity as defined in ISO 17442.

fields.label: North American Industry Classification System Code (naics > Text)
fields.name: brandorg_naics
fields.instructions: The NAICS code for a particular organization or business person.

fields.label: Taxpayer Identification Number (taxID > Text)
fields.name: brandorg_taxid
fields.instructions: The Taxpayer Identification Number of the organization.

fields.label: Value-Added Tax Identification Number (vatID > Text)
fields.name: brandorg_vatid
fields.instructions: The Value-added Tax ID of the organization or person.

fields.label: Does this organization have a listing on Google My Business?
fields.name: brandorg_google_cid_query

fields.label: Other Identifier (identifier > PropertyValue)
fields.name: brandorg_identifier
fields.instructions: The identifier property represents any kind of identifier for any kind of Thing, such as ISBNs, GTIN codes, UUIDs etc. Schema.org provides dedicated properties for representing many of these, either as textual strings or as URL (URI) links.

sub_fields.label: Identifier Name (name > Text)
sub_fields.name: brandorg_identifier_name
sub_fields.instructions: The name of the identifier property

sub_fields.label: Identifier Value (value > Boolean or Number or Text)
sub_fields.name: brandorg_identifier_value
sub_fields.instructions: The value of the identifier property

sub_fields.label: Identifier Maximum Value (maxValue > Number)
sub_fields.name: brandorg_identifier_maxvalue
sub_fields.instructions: The upper value of the identifier property

sub_fields.label: Identifier Minimum Value (minValue > Number)
sub_fields.name: brandorg_identifier_minvalue
sub_fields.instructions: The lower value of the identifier property

sub_fields.label: Identifier Property Identifier (propertyID > URL)
sub_fields.name: brandorg_identifier_propertyid
sub_fields.instructions: A commonly used identifier for the characteristic represented by the property (e.g., a manufacturer or a standard code for a property). propertyID can be (1) a prefixed string, mainly meant to be used with standards for product properties; (2) a site-specific, non-prefixed string (e.g. the primary key of the property or the vendor-specific ID of the property), or (3) a URL indicating the type of the property, either pointing to an external vocabulary, or a Web resource that describes the property (e.g., a glossary entry). Standards bodies should promote a standard prefix for the identifiers of properties from their standards.

sub_fields.label: Identifier Unit Code (unitCode > Text or URL)
sub_fields.name: brandorg_identifier_unitcode
sub_fields.instructions: The unit of measurement given using the UN/CEFACT Common Code (3 characters) or a URL. Codes other than the UN/CEFACT Common Code may be used with a prefix followed by a colon.

sub_fields.label: Identifier Unit Text (unitText > Text)
sub_fields.name: brandorg_identifier_unittext
sub_fields.instructions: A string or text indicating the unit of measurement. Useful if you cannot provide a standard unit code for unitCode.

sub_fields.label: Identifier URL (url > URL)
sub_fields.name: brandorg_identifier_url
sub_fields.instructions: URL of the identifier property value
